links.*: The 1979 Calendar of J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings
The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''?''' - ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[A Hobbit's Travels]]'' is published.

==February==
* '''[[6 February|6]]''' -  William Sievert publishes the article "''[[A Mania for Middle-earth]]''" in the ''Chronicle for Higher Education''.
* '''[[17 February|17]]''' - Actor [[Rory Michael Kinnear]] is born.

==April==
* '''?''' -  Rob Kuntz publishes the essay "''[[Tolkien in D&D]]''" in ''Dragon'' magazine.

==June==
* '''[[2 June|2]]''' - Tolkien scholar [[Dimitra Fimi]] is born.

==August==
* '''[[11 August|11]]-[[13 August|13]]''' - [[Mythcon 9]].

==September==
* '''[[22 September|22]]-[[24 September|24]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 1978]].
==October==
* '''?''' - ''[[The Inklings (book)|The Inklings: C.S. Lewis, J.R.R. Tolkien, Charles Williams and Their Friends]]'' is published.
==November==
* '''[[15 November|15]]''' - [[Ralph Bakshi]]'s ''[[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)|The Lord of the Rings]]'' premieres in the United States. 
* '''[[28 November|28]]''' - Actor [[André Morell]] dies.

==December==
* '''?''' - ''[[The Tolkien Scrapbook]]'' is published.
==?==
* '''?''' - ''[[Lightning from a Clear Sky|Lightning from a Clear Sky: Tolkien, The Trilogy, and The Silmarillion]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - [[The 1979 Calendar of J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings]] is released.
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar 1979]] is released.
* '''?''' - [[The Silmarillion Desk Calendar 1979]] is released.
